name: Lighthouse Fish Market
address: 2449 Frederick Douglass Blvd, New York, NY 10027, USA

reviews.text: Food was so freaking delicious, worth the wait. And you have the option to get your food grilled, fried, sauteed, or steamed! That's living people!

Everything tastes good especially those wings and that salmon. I really enjoy there food! Come here if you looking for soul food/seafood. It's so busy/crowded no where to sit although they have other locations where you can sit. I love the the one on St. Nicholas Ave. Food is well cooked and seasoned.
Fast service food was fresh the vibe was perfect. Music was good. There's not people standing around making you feel uncomfortable. Everyone is welcome is how i felt. Lady at the register was kind.
The food was amazing with generous portions! I do wish they had some seating.

Why‚Ä¶.please tell me WHY are the crab legs SALTY when as requested they are steamed with No Old Bay seasoning.  Why and How is that happening not just once but TWICE.  This is terrible!!!! Got Crab Legs on Friday, couldn‚Äôt finish them paid $130 for legs/shrimp/rice/broccoli only ate the shrimp/rice/broccoli.  After trying 1 leg from the 6 clusters purchased the Salt was overwhelming.  Same thing happened on Sunday. WHYYYYYYY?????   I WILL BE SEEING THE MANAGER   If you taste any salty taste on your ‚Äúrequested unseasoned crab legs‚Äù. GET ALL YOUR MONEY BACK IMMEDIATELY!  This should not happen!üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°ü•µü•µü•µü•µü•µ

This place was smelling Awfully rancidity and it wasn't the food.
Rats ran everywhere outside and waiting to get in would best be done by staying in your car.
Best place to get late night seafood!
Have not been there yet, Google has been sending me around and around sent covid.
Fresh flowers were available.
Employees were efficient and friendly.
The food is great I just wish they had a delivery service...
Enjoy the portion size very generous n the fried fish catfish I had was fresh tasting crunch not over fired it smelled  love all the sides. I will be returning !
Staff are knowledgeable about products.
Lighthouse Fish Market good food fish is the best
I walked all the way from my hotel to here at the recommendation of a colleague while visiting only to find out that they are cash only!   That was a long walk.
The store carried many popular brands.

Food wasn't bad but it wasn't what I expected. Maybe I picked the wrong flavor for the chicken but the butter garlic was the wrong flavor for me. I will have to come back and try it out again just not the butter garlic. They will allow you to sample the juice / Kool-aid flavors they have before you buy it.
Good amount of vegetarian options.

Food has fell off. Not sure if its under New management. However the mac n chz wasn't cheesy or good, felt like I was eating elbow noodles. The yams didn't taste fresh and the salmon dinner with fried shrimp was okay.
Also, it took the servers forever to make your food.
I like the healthy food section.
The food is incredible!
Employees were patient and kind.
Always a friendly goodbye at checkout.
The store had clear signs and directions.

The food was absolutely terrible.  I went to a birthday dinner here last night.  Horrible prefix menu.  $130 each person.  For a "slice" of Salmon, 2 bland Terrible sides and 4 wingettes. We had 1 waiter serving 20 people.  I will Never go here again.  I would recommend.... that you do the same.
Only thing missing is the ability to eat in. I ordered the whiting dinner with yams and potato salad yum is not the word. The iced tea is sweet and the staff is friendly. Be prepared it's CASH ONLY.
The shop was comfortable to browse.
Staff work efficiently.
I like their breakfast section.
Harlem
Excellent food but I highly recommend another method of payment other than cash
Lots of gluten-free options here.
The staff answer questions politely.
The store had comfortable lighting.
Good variety of frozen vegetables.
The food is on point!
The cat fish is amazing. I wanted a catfish dinner but had to settle for a sandwich because they were out of string beans and cauliflower. The crab cake was ok. The side of yellow rice was delicious.
The lighthouse is fabulous shrimp  Lingini,steam salmon with vegetables is great, and the seasoning is just right, keep up the good works guys
Food is amazing i been going here for 10+ years and the food never tasted difference !!!

I made a b-line for this place after hearing Teyanna Taylor mention it in an interview. Baaby it did not disappoint. Food was on point. I love the concept of a seafood market integrated with a seafood takeaway. Service was very slow, that was the only gripe.
The food was delicious and they serve you very generous portions for the price.

I ordered from Uber eats
and when I finished i was very full and satistfied. Seasoned well and tasty.
Place is way to small , Can‚Äôt order pick up , only cash , always a line , let‚Äôs just say the people that go there is ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.. food is good everything else not so much

Customer service is horrible, the menu prices are wrong, and the response was that‚Äôs the other location not here, and and tells me to talk to the boss. When I asked who was the boss I was told to call the number on the menu. After all this I was still gonna get the food because I haven‚Äôt eaten all day then I was told it‚Äôs cash only and they have a card machine in your face. Very unprofessional

Had a coworker order for us and he picked up.  Excellent food!!!!
Wings- Tasty!!!!
Seafood mac- AMAZING!!!!!
crad cakes- delicious!!!!!!
A line to order your food.  And a long wait to receive your food.  The food is good, it worth the wait.

1st time there ordered fish n mac n cheese.fish was fried too hard
Wasn't impressed üòï
Great lobster w Mac
Food is always fresh and good

Don't expect anything fancy. This is just a order and pick up restaurant. You order at the counter then wait on the side for them to prepare your food. You can also pick out fresh seafood and veggies then have it steamed.  The food was delicious and worth the price. There were too many workers behind the counter, seemed disorganized.

Nothing like before! I think they split the filet. We ordered the fish, shrimp, and chips, the chips (fries) was the only thing decent. Very disappointed as I frequently visited this place when I lived here a few years ago. Thought I was bringing others to a decent place where the line would be very long, not today. Won't be coming back

It‚Äôs hard to give it three stars. Only my second time trying this spot. Everything was great first time. We had the Rasta pasta and fish and shrimp combo. This time it was overcooked everything. The seafood Mac and cheese pasta was so overcooked, it practically melted but it looked great and had a nice cheese crust on top. I think they left it in the oven too long. Also didn‚Äôt see any seafood then maybe crab and some cut up pieces of shrimp which was disappointing. Fried calamari was chewy like rubber bc it‚Äôs overcooked. There was a green weird looking fry in my fries so that wasn‚Äôt great either. We also got a slice of Oreo cake, it was delicious but very thin slice which is fine but yeah it didn‚Äôt feel great spending $$ this time.

I bought a shrimp empanada thinking it wasn‚Äôt gonna be nothing but normal‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ it was definitely a surprise soo flavorful and delicious definitely worth the purchase can‚Äôt wait to comeback and try more btw I went to the food truck on 125th just tastes more fresh

Delicious food! I tried for the first time from one of their food trucks on 125th. I enjoyed the fried catfish and shrimp combo with fries and collard greens. Perfectly fried and seasoned. I will definitely return to their storefront to try other items on the menu

I went to the food truck today on 125th.. and let me say.. NEVER again. Fish was small and overcooked. The shrimp were average but everything needed more seasoning. Last 4 small whiting and 5 shrimp for $18 is more than disrespectful to the community. I‚Äôll keep going to Make My Fish across from Amy Ruth‚Äôs on 116th. I‚Äôm convinced yall who say the food was good have never had southern soul food yall standards are super low!

Today was my first time trying this restaurant. I am pregnant and craved fried fish so I ordered baked mac and cheese, cabbage and fried fish. The mac and cheese and cabbage was good. However, the fried fish was awful. It was either very old or has been out for a long time, after being over cooked. I bit into one and ate straight battered oil, and quickly started to feel sick. It was about 6:00pm, it's now 10:34pm and I just stopped using the bathroom and still feel sick.

I will video my doctor in the morning if I still feel sick.
Please note; Whiting fish should always be made fresh to order.
I am saddened by my experience because now I do not feel well.

The ypung lady was very nice, the food was sooooo flavorful and the atmosphere was on point. I drive from new jersey at least once a month for this great experience. FYI I order the Salmon over rice with garlic butter, the deep fried catfish, and the chicken &Shrimp combo with mac and cheese with potato salad(i forgot to ask for sticky sauce). Trust when I say my fiance and I were not disappointed üòãüòã.

I went for the 1st time staff were attentive and friendly.  Food was seasoned well. Fish was cooked well and tasted delicious.  They gave a lot of food and reasonable price.Drinks were strong. Playlist was a 10/10. Will come back

This was a recommendation from another reviewer of a restaurant. I would have to say that this food was like my grandmother‚Äôs or from a family member. the yams was on point the Mac and cheese was good and the collard was on point fried whiting and was good and crispy large portion for your money. I definitely would go again when I‚Äôm in the area or when I want some southern food. Thank you Kelly Welly

This takeout spot was recommended to me by a friend who knows someone that works here. This business is busy on a Friday night as to be expected.  The lady ringing orders is professional, polite, and efficient. I ordered the fish and shrimp dinner and a side of scallops, which was all respectable 20-minute wait. Watching how the staff works together in a tight space and maintaining a clean working space, it should make sense why the wait is what it is. My favorite was the Mac and cheese.  It's been a while since I've eaten seasoned Mac.  The greens were tasty and tender as well. The fish was overcooked. Needless to say, the food was good enough for me to come back again to try the steamed option and the infamous lobster fries.

Atmosphere is incredible. Kind of hibachi cause you see your food being made right there. Workers are so nice while they are putting in 100% in at the same time. The food, don‚Äôt even get me started. I‚Äôm not a seafood person so I come here to the wings. My oh my the best in the city! Shout out garlic parmesan

FOOD WAS  AMAZING!!! Everything was so tasteful. I ordered the bbq wings yellow rice and Mac and cheese. Mac and cheese was 10/10
The rice was a 10/10 and the wings was a 10/10 with a side of Ranch ugh just soo good !!!

The food is out of this world,  made upon request. The wait time is worth it. Taking my order was easy, and the cashier was exceptional. I watched my food get cooked right in front of me. They have security to keep the flow smooth and, again, the food amazing. You need to come and check it for yourself

I‚Äôve been wanting some tasty fish for a few weeks now.   I‚Äôve heard about Lighthouse from friends and decided to give it a try.  I‚Äôve even heard the line is usually out the door.  I decided to give it a try especially with the snowy weather I knew it wouldn‚Äôt be as crowded.  When I arrived at the restaurant the staff was very welcoming and helpful.  The only thing that I wasn‚Äôt pleased with is the restaurant is taking cash only.  I was very disappointed especially since when I checked on the website on the menu it says they except cards which is why I‚Äôm taking off a star.   I had to use the ATM machine in the restaurant to withdraw money.  This isn‚Äôt a sit down restaurant to enjoy your meal, you order and take your food to go.  There is also a section to purchase seafood.  I was pleased they actually have whiting fish usually when I go to a seafood place, they tell me they have whiting but end up giving me tilapia.  The whiting was also filet so I was really able to enjoy the fish without worrying about any bones.  The fish was lightly seasoned and delicious.  The yams, cabbage, and macaroni and cheese were also delicious. I didn‚Äôt like the garlic mashed potatoes it had a weird taste to it.  I also didn‚Äôt like the collard greens very bland and a bit too hard for my liking.  The chicken was a bit salty and the skin of the chicken was rubbery but the honey BBQ sauce was good.  The portions are also a good size for the price.  The food is fresh and made to order so you have to wait a little while for your food so if you‚Äôre in a rush this may not be what you‚Äôre looking for.  Great music selection while you wait for your food.

We been calling all week no answer we still decided to go because my aunt said the food was good. We get there a party of 9 they try to get us to get prefixed menus starting at $100 each per person or a $60 per person. We decided to split our party so we had to sit at two different tables which was wack because we were there to celebrate my aunts graduation. As they were walking us to the table the lady that sat us was like what‚Äôs in the bag we said cupcakes she said oh you gonna have to pay $35 for bringing  that in here so we had to take the cupcakes back to car. (Again we called a few times during the week to get a better understanding of the rules and no answer) My aunt kept going back and forth from table to table. We ordered our food and drinks they kept forgetting my aunts friends orders first it was her drink then it was part of her food.We order an appetizer and it didn‚Äôt come till after we already got our food. The tables are too small to seat 5 ppl. My cousin stop by to just bring my aunt some flowers and she wasn‚Äôt allowed back where we were the lady that sat us told her we would have to come to the front to get the flowers I found that kind of crazy because she was literally bringing flowers and leaving. If you eat here get your food to go.  The food was great I can‚Äôt complain.

Went here with a couple of friends and I really enjoyed the food.  This won't be your healthy food stop but it will be one of your most enjoyable meals.

Actually they do have fish that you can order steamed which you pick out yourself along with vegetables.  So for that friend on a diet you still can get what you want.  However you'll probably stare at your friends plate with the fried food drooling wondering why you have to be the healthy eater counting calories.

Came back after a few years and the food is still great and the blue lemonade is delicious.

1st time not the last small place for to go food salmon croquettes were delicious you get 2 large size with you choice of sides I had the Mac and cheese with cabbage the portion of food is a good amount couldn't eat it all! I had blueberry lemonade my other half had the catfish sandwich said it was gooood!
Thank you Lighthouse for serving good quality food and service keep up the excellent wk and may you serve for yrs to come!!!

Is a small place. You can get steamed food or fry food. The fry food is faster the steamed takes a little longer. The staff are very clean what i love is that they wear gloves for everything. The staff makes you feel welcomed And they are‚Ä¶
The food was fresh delicious and seasoned very well and all the juices were delicious

I saw a video review, by a British tourist, and thought I'd give Lighthouse a try. You can see the attached receipt for the order details.
The music is a bit loud, so you must speak up when ordering. The cashier repeated each part of my order but the music remained a hindrance. The general appearance was clean and smelled well, despite the fresh fish cleaning. The wait was over 20 mins but should have been shorter, as I noticed the wings being tossed at least 10 minutes prior. Also, what turned out to be my order had been on the counter for more than five mins before my number (along with  four others) was called. It seems that there was a backup of prep and issuance of orders.
When I got home, some 15 mins later, the food was still warm. The wings were fried hard (down to the meat) and I think that took away from the flavor. The garlic mashed potatoes were tasty but not outstanding (I'll try them HOT for better taste). The collard greens taste about the same as most restaurants (I could taste the salt in them). As with the mashed potatoes, I'll try them HOT. I liked the texture of the porgy, the best (head on!). The meat of the fish flaked away easily. So, do try the porgy.
Now, about the drink. There were four dispensers, with four flavors (blue, peach mango, strawberry pineapple and I have no idea). I tried the strawberry (it rang up as peach mango) and you'll be addicted. If, you like sugar in your kool-aid then this is your place. I tried it straight and 1/2 water. There has got to be a happy medium!
Overall, I can see why Lighthouse is popular and you should give a try.

This was the first time I ever went to Lighthouse.  I walked in and it felt like home.  The chef was grilling while the front-end worker was taking orders.  The frozen food was laid out in a neat manner for you to select what you want in your dish.  I picked a steamed option: Salmon, Shrimp, Broccoli and StringBeans with a Side of  seasoned rice.  I ate off of this pan for 2 whole days... It was So Good.

The food here is so good, and such a clutch location for late night cravings as they‚Äôre open pretty late. I‚Äôve had aplenty soul food before (mostly in California) and this is definitely up there in my favorites. I‚Äôve only gotten the catfish dinner plate and it‚Äôs so good I haven‚Äôt even wanted to try anything else; however, seeing everyone‚Äôs orders waiting for them I‚Äôm always tempted to try. something new. It all just looks so good. With that being said, it‚Äôs delicious and open late so inevitably there‚Äôs more than likely going to be a line/wait, which personally I have no problem with. I‚Äôve reviewed them on Yelp because I think this place 100% deserves a good rating for their food, portion sizes, pricing (for the most part) and the fact they stay open so late, and it‚Äôs just funny to see people calling the food here ‚Äúunseasoned‚Äù, ‚Äúsalty‚Äù or saying they ‚Äúadded sugar to the greens.‚Äù First of all, if anyone‚Äôs putting sugar in their greens that‚Äôs a red flag, and if the foods salty then I think that‚Äôs a conversation for you and your doctor. This place is absolutely worth a try

I almost never leave reviews but I've decided to start making a habit out of it after eating here.

Let's start with the good. The place has an A rating in NYC. The store is clean. The staff is friendly. Prices are fine (about $9 to $14 for lunch depending on what you order). I ordered the fish and chips ($9). What I was expecting was 4 pieces of fish, as stated, some fries, tartar sauce, and maybe a lemon wedge.

So I got four pieces of fish, but the fish they used wasn't cod or haddock. Instead it was some cheap white fish. It was bland and tasteless. They used a cornmeal breading instead of a traditional batter, and the fish was very oily. It came with a lot of fries. The entire order weighed easily a pound. But the fries were extremely oily and they were caked with the same breading used for the fish. Also, they didn't give me any tartar sauce or lemon.

Overall, the food quality is very low. I wouldn't recommend it.

I love this place! Being from the south having a authentic fried fish restaurant close by has been amazing. I‚Äôve tried many dishes here from fish baskets to three wings to the crab legs and seafood medley Alfredo. IT‚ÄôS ALL DELICIOUS. It‚Äôs a‚Ä¶

Food is pretty good, but not worth the wait. More importantly it‚Äôs an easily solvable problem. No phone orders, no online orders. Not only does it make no sense for your customers to have to walk in to order and wait an hour with no alerts when it‚Äôs ready, but it means crazy double and triple parking all up and down the entire street. Update your ordering system. It makes absolutely zero sense other than just not wanting to.

UPDATE: a year later. My elderly neighbors also complaining about the rats, the insane trash left all over the streets, the fights, the insanely bad ordering system. They can‚Äôt possibly deal with the chaos of that line, or think about ordering food here. So incredibly disrespectful to your neighborhood. Business is genuinely a problem on this block. Ask any other the other incredible businesses what they really think of Lighthouse and how they treat their neighborhood. So bad.

UPDATE with new pics: many years later. Nothing has changed. Fire trucks can't get through many nights. Tonight garbage trucks triple parking just to pick up trash. Horns going off like crazy every time something like this happens. Every night. EVERY SINGLE NIGHT. Lighthouse is virtually flipping off all their neighbors and the hardworking people that keep this city going. It seems nothing will ever be done about this restaurant and its patrons that decide to jack up the entire block for hours on end.

Food is very tasty and delicious! First time there and It was a good experience. Luckily I had cash because they do not accept card payments. Also, I suggest that you go and order food when you don‚Äôt have plans or wait in the car or outside because the kitchen is in display and you will smell like food. Their drinks are also worth the price.
Food truck on 125th is very unorganized. Workers lack customer service skills. I would recommend spending your money elsewhere.
Tiny dry pieces of whiting and their Mac is wack. Candied yams were decent. Only ordered from here bc taste of seafood is closed on mondays I‚Äôll wait next time smh

Dine in service was terrible, the staff had an attitude from the moment my party walked in. It was for a birthday dinner and we felt rushed the entire night. One of the so called "bouncers" I guess, I don't know he looked tacky, got particularly upset because we were waiting for our bill to get settled since it was suddenly cash only and said that "we wanted to act grown so start to act like it" however no one said anything of the sort, we were just waiting for our bill. It's not worth coming here to dine in.

The seafood mac and cheese with crab meat, lobster and shrimp omg! It tastes so go the shrimp with collard greens and garlic mash was do good. I have no complaints at all. The fresh fruit juice comes in 24 oz self pour both flavors so good pineapple with strawberry and the strawberry with kiwi puuurrrrrfect. I love everything that I ordered.

It was beautiful there, the food was delicious but it‚Äôs no place to chill and have conversations the music was loud. If you‚Äôre going just to eat their food it‚Äôs amazing! Also they only accept cash which I kind of found annoying.
Food was absolutely breathtaking my mom & I came today from westchester, will definitely be visiting again. The mango juice was fire!!!

Food - Good: Fish and shrimp is seasoned well and cooked perfectly. Pasta is tasty. The food is heavy, and plentiful. The infamous lobster fries used imitation lobster, which explains the low price for the quantity.

Service - Good: The ladies managed the kitchen well under the circumstances. Do not order the seafood platter or pasta if in a rush. Average wait time for most orders is 30-45mins.

Overall - Recommend. This is not fine dinning or event a sit down. For tasty seafood in the area, it‚Äôs a solid option for take out/pick up based on flavor, quantity and price. One regular order of anything can possibly feed a family of 4.
